title: Member Preview: Monet and Chicago
hero_caption: Claude Monet. Water Lily Pond, 1900. Mr. and Mrs. Lewis Larned Coburn Memorial Collection. Art Institute of Chicago.
short_description: Enjoy two full days of member-only access to Monet and Chicago before the exhibition opens to the public.
list_description: Enjoy two full days of member-only access to Monet and Chicago before the exhibition opens to the public.
description:
Enjoy two full days of member only access to Monet and Chicago before the exhibition opens to the public.

Simply show your member card or digital member card to enter.

Not yet a member? Become one today to enjoy this exhibition ahead of the crowds. 

To see certain exhibitions, including Monet and Chicago, you will have to join a virtual line. We recommend that you join the virtual line as soon as you enter the museum.

Stop by the Modern Wing information desk or the exhibition entrance for instructions on how to reserve your spot via text. You’ll receive a text message when it’s your turn to enter the exhibition. Remember, the member line moves a bit faster than the line for the general public.
